name: against
posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: against
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: disagreeing with a plan or activity

example.eg: She spoke against the decision to close the college.
example.egtrans: 她声言反对关闭学院的决定。

example.eg: 50 people voted against the new proposal.
example.egtrans: 50人投票反对这一新提案。

example.eg: I'm very much against the idea that it is the woman's job to bring up the child.
example.egtrans: 对于抚养孩子是女人的活儿这一想法，我坚决反对。

example.eg: Germany are playing against Brazil in the cup final tonight.
example.egtrans: 德国队在今晚的决赛中对阵巴西队。

example.eg: She's always rebelled against authority.
example.egtrans: 她总是对抗权威。

example.eg: She sold the house even though it was against his wishes.
example.egtrans: 她卖掉了房子，尽管这违背了他的愿望。

example.eg: They called a demonstration to protest against proposed job cuts.
example.egtrans: 他们召集了示威游行来抗议削减工作机会的提议。

example.eg: Are you for or against my proposal?
example.egtrans: 你赞成还是反对我的提议？

example.eg: Sanctions against the country should be lifted.
example.egtrans: 应该取消对这个国家的制裁。

example.eg: Stricter controls will help in the fight against inflation.
example.egtrans: 更加严厉的调控措施将有助于抑制通货膨胀。

example.eg: Criminal charges will be brought against the driver.
example.egtrans: 将对司机提起刑事诉讼。

example.eg: They decided not to take legal action against him.
example.egtrans: 他们决定不起诉他。

example.eg: They were up against a powerful pressure group.
example.egtrans: 他们面临一个强大的压力集团。

example.eg: We came up against a lot of problems in the course of building our extension.
example.egtrans: 我们在扩建过程中遇到好多问题。

example.eg: The chances/odds against you winning such a competition are enormous.
example.egtrans: 你赢得这样一场比赛的可能性极小。

example.eg: It's against the law (= illegal) to leave children under a certain age alone in the house.
example.egtrans: 将某个年龄以下的孩子单独留在家里是违法的。

example.eg: It's against my beliefs/principles to be nice to someone I dislike just because they're in a senior position.
example.egtrans: 对于我厌恶的人，我不会仅仅因为他比我职位高就对其和颜悦色，这有违我的处世原则。

example.eg: Against all probability (= although it was extremely unlikely) we found ourselves in the same hotel.
example.egtrans: 不可思议的是，我们发现自己竟然住进了同一家旅馆。

example.eg: I wouldn't dare say anything against him (= criticize him) to his mother!
example.egtrans: 我不敢对他妈妈说他的坏话！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you have something against someone, you dislike them for a reason.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 因（某种原因）不喜欢（某人）

example.eg: I've nothing against him - I just don't have much in common with him.
example.egtrans: 我一点都不讨厌他，只是和他没有太多相似之处。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something counts/goes/works against you, it gives you a disadvantage.

example.eg: Lack of experience will generally count against you in an interview.
example.egtrans: 一般而言，缺乏工作经验会成为面试的不利因素。

dsense.name: against
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: next to and touching or being supported by (something)

example.eg: Why don't we put the bed against the wall?
example.egtrans: 为什么不把床紧靠墙放呢？

example.eg: He loved the feel of her soft hair against his skin.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢她那柔滑的头发贴着他的肌肤的感觉。

example.eg: The rain beat against her face as she struggled through the wind.
example.egtrans: 她在风雨中艰难行进，雨水打在她的脸上。

example.eg: The police officer had him up against the wall, both arms behind his back.
example.egtrans: 警察把他双手别在身后按到墙上。

example.eg: She leaned against the door.
example.egtrans: 她倚着门。

trans_examp.trans_en: in front of or compared to
trans_examp.trans_cn: 以…为背景；以…作衬托；和…对照

example.eg: Paintings look best against a simple white wall.
example.egtrans: 画挂在没有任何装饰的白墙上看上去效果最好。

dsense.name: against
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

example.eg: The last part of the course was hard because I was running against the wind.
example.egtrans: 最后一段赛程很艰难，因为我是顶风跑。

example.eg: Commuting is not so bad when you are travelling against the traffic.
example.egtrans: 如果你是逆着主车流而行，乘车上下班倒也不错。

dsense.name: against
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: as a protection or defence from the bad effects of

example.eg: We've insured the car against fire, theft, and accident.
example.egtrans: 我们给车上了火灾险、窃盗险和交通事故险。

example.eg: The police have to arm themselves against attack.
example.egtrans: 警察必须得配备武器以防受到攻击。
